ReportItem.description:
This plugin displays, for each tested host, information about the scan itself :
- The version of the plugin set. - The type of scanner (Nessus or Nessus Home). - The version of the Nessus Engine. - The port scanner(s) used. - The port range scanned. - Whether credentialed or third-party patch management checks are possible. - The date of the scan. - The duration of the scan. - The number of hosts scanned in parallel. - The number of checks done in parallel.
ReportItem.synopsis: This plugin displays information about the Nessus scan.
ReportItem.plugin_output:

ReportItem.pluginName: SSL Certificate Chain Contains Certificates Expiring Soon
ReportItem.description: The remote host has an SSL certificate chain with one or more SSL certificates that are going to expire soon. Failure to renew these certificates before the expiration date may result in denial of service for users.
ReportItem.plugin_name: SSL Certificate Chain Contains Certificates Expiring Soon
ReportItem.solution: Renew any soon to expire SSL certificates.
ReportItem.synopsis: The remote host has an SSL certificate chain with one or more certificates that are going to expire soon.
ReportItem.plugin_output:
The following soon to expire certificate was part of the certificate chain sent by the remote host :
|-Subject : CN=www.sitealeatorio.com.br |-Not After : May 29 16:39:40 2018 GMT

ReportItem.pluginName: Web Site Cross-Domain Policy File Detection
ReportItem.description: The remote web server contains a cross-domain policy file. This is a simple XML file used by Adobe's Flash Player to allow access to data that resides outside the exact web domain from which a Flash movie file originated.
ReportItem.plugin_name: Web Site Cross-Domain Policy File Detection
ReportItem.solution: Review the contents of the policy file carefully. Improper policies, especially an unrestricted one with just '*', could allow for cross- site request forgery and cross-site scripting attacks against the web server.
ReportItem.synopsis: The remote web server contains a 'crossdomain.xml' file.
ReportItem.plugin_output:
Nessus was able to obtain a cross-domain policy file from the remote host using the following URL :
https://www.sitealeatorio.com.br/crossdomain.xml

ReportItem.description: The remote HTTPS server is not enforcing HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS). The lack of HSTS allows downgrade attacks, SSL-stripping man-in-the-middle attacks, and weakens cookie-hijacking protections.
ReportItem.solution: Configure the remote web server to use HSTS.
ReportItem.synopsis: The remote web server is not enforcing HSTS.
ReportItem.plugin_output: The remote HTTPS server does not send the HTTP "Strict-Transport-Security" header.

ReportItem.description: The remote host contains a file named 'robots.txt' that is intended to prevent web 'robots' from visiting certain directories in a website for maintenance or indexing purposes. A malicious user may also be able to use the contents of this file to learn of sensitive documents or directories on the affected site and either retrieve them directly or target them for other attacks.
ReportItem.solution: Review the contents of the site's robots.txt file, use Robots META tags instead of entries in the robots.txt file, and/or adjust the web server's access controls to limit access to sensitive material.
ReportItem.synopsis: The remote web server contains a 'robots.txt' file.
ReportItem.plugin_output:

..poca cosm..ticos | uma empresa do grupo Magazineluiza

A ..poca acredita no poder transformador de explorar a pr..pria beleza. Porque ser capaz de explorar sua beleza .. experimentar mil formas de se sentir bel❤ e, dessa forma, se descobrir dela.

Quer saber mais sobre a gente?

Somos o e-commerce mais completo em cuidados e est..tica do Brasil, fundado h.. 26 anos atr..s pela fam..lia Milman, no bairro de Ipanema, Rio de Janeiro. Em 2013 passou a fazer parte do Grupo Magazine Luiza, da empres..ria Luiza Helena Trajano.

Aqui voc.. encontra os lan..amentos de cosm..ticos e perfumaria mais esperados e as tend..ncias de beleza mais comentadas. Nossas prateleiras s..o recheadas com itens selecionados como as fragr..ncias ic..nicas La Vie Est Belle e Good Girl, das marcas Lanc..me e Carolina Herrera e o tradicional J...Adore da Dior. Al..m dos perfumes masculinos mais comentados como One Million e Invictus de Paco Rabanne.

Se est.. em busca de uma pele perfeita e uma make para o look do dia, b..sico ou avassalador, tamb..m podemos ajudar! Navegando pelo site voc.. tamb..m vai encontrar uma vasta linha de tratamentos e dermocosm..ticos para cuidados com a pele, corpo e rosto como os queridinhos BB cream e ..gua termal, al..m de v..rias marcas de protetor solar e dermocosm..ticos em geral, pois temos orgulho de dizer que somos a loja preferida dos grandes dermatologistas do Brasil. Aqui voc.. se cuida e encontra meios de expor a sua personalidade atrav..s da beleza, j.. que certamente vai encontrar uma infinidade de cores e texturas de batom, r..mel, base, sombra, delineador e esmalte para deixar sua produ....o ainda mais do seu jeito.

Se o que busca s..o produtos para os cabelos, como shampoos, m..scaras e finalizadores... oferecemos tratamentos espec..ficos cada tipo de cabelo e necessidade. Sejam cabelos quimicamente tratados, danificados, em transi....o capilar, etc.

Al..m de tudo isso, voc.. ainda vai encontrar muito conte..do e dicas incr..veis de beleza navegando nas p..ginas dos nossos produtos e tamb..m no nosso blog, Papo de Beleza. ;)

Gostou? N..s tamb..m amamos que voc.. est.. aqui! ❤

Ent..o entre e fique a vontade porque aqui o ..nico mood .. ser feliz.

ReportItem.pluginName: Web Server No 404 Error Code Check
ReportItem.description:
The remote web server is configured such that it does not return '404 Not Found' error codes when a nonexistent file is requested, perhaps returning instead a site map, search page or authentication page.
Nessus has enabled some counter measures for this. However, they might be insufficient. If a great number of security holes are produced for this port, they might not all be accurate.
ReportItem.plugin_name: Web Server No 404 Error Code Check
ReportItem.synopsis: The remote web server does not return 404 error codes.
ReportItem.plugin_output:
CGI scanning will be disabled for this host because the host responds to requests for non-existent URLs with HTTP code 301 rather than 404. The requested URL was :
http://www.sitealeatorio.com.br/a0jLbgnKl3Xp.html

ReportItem.description:

ReportItem.pluginName: SSL Cipher Block Chaining Cipher Suites Supported
ReportItem.description: The remote host supports the use of SSL ciphers that operate in Cipher Block Chaining (CBC) mode. These cipher suites offer additional security over Electronic Codebook (ECB) mode, but have the potential to leak information if used improperly.
ReportItem.plugin_name: SSL Cipher Block Chaining Cipher Suites Supported
ReportItem.synopsis: The remote service supports the use of SSL Cipher Block Chaining ciphers, which combine previous blocks with subsequent ones.
ReportItem.plugin_output:
Here is the list of SSL CBC ciphers supported by the remote server :
High Strength Ciphers (>= 112-bit key)
ECDHE-RSA-AES128-SHA Kx=ECDH Au=RSA Enc=AES-CBC(128) Mac=SHA1 ECDHE-RSA-AES256-SHA Kx=ECDH Au=RSA Enc=AES-CBC(256) Mac=SHA1 AES128-SHA Kx=RSA Au=RSA Enc=AES-CBC(128) Mac=SHA1 AES256-SHA Kx=RSA Au=RSA Enc=AES-CBC(256) Mac=SHA1 ECDHE-RSA-AES128-SHA256 Kx=ECDH Au=RSA Enc=AES-CBC(128) Mac=SHA256 ECDHE-RSA-AES256-SHA384 Kx=ECDH Au=RSA Enc=AES-CBC(256) Mac=SHA384 RSA-AES128-SHA256 Kx=RSA Au=RSA Enc=AES-CBC(128) Mac=SHA256
The fields above are :
{OpenSSL ciphername} Kx={key exchange} Au={authentication} Enc={symmetric encryption method} Mac={message authentication code} {export flag}

ReportItem.pluginName: SSL Perfect Forward Secrecy Cipher Suites Supported
ReportItem.description: The remote host supports the use of SSL ciphers that offer Perfect Forward Secrecy (PFS) encryption. These cipher suites ensure that recorded SSL traffic cannot be broken at a future date if the server's private key is compromised.
ReportItem.plugin_name: SSL Perfect Forward Secrecy Cipher Suites Supported
ReportItem.synopsis: The remote service supports the use of SSL Perfect Forward Secrecy ciphers, which maintain confidentiality even if the key is stolen.
ReportItem.plugin_output:
Here is the list of SSL PFS ciphers supported by the remote server :
High Strength Ciphers (>= 112-bit key)
ECDHE-RSA-AES128-SHA256 Kx=ECDH Au=RSA Enc=AES-GCM(128) Mac=SHA256 ECDHE-RSA-AES256-SHA384 Kx=ECDH Au=RSA Enc=AES-GCM(256) Mac=SHA384 ECDHE-RSA-AES128-SHA Kx=ECDH Au=RSA Enc=AES-CBC(128) Mac=SHA1 ECDHE-RSA-AES256-SHA Kx=ECDH Au=RSA Enc=AES-CBC(256) Mac=SHA1 ECDHE-RSA-AES128-SHA256 Kx=ECDH Au=RSA Enc=AES-CBC(128) Mac=SHA256 ECDHE-RSA-AES256-SHA384 Kx=ECDH Au=RSA Enc=AES-CBC(256) Mac=SHA384

ReportItem.description:
By using information obtained from a Nessus scan, this plugin reports CPE (Common Platform Enumeration) matches for various hardware and software products found on a host.
Note that if an official CPE is not available for the product, this plugin computes the best possible CPE based on the information available from the scan.
ReportItem.synopsis: It was possible to enumerate CPE names that matched on the remote system.
ReportItem.plugin_output:
The remote operating system matched the following CPE's :
cpe:/o:linux:linux_kernel:2.2 cpe:/o:linux:linux_kernel:2.4 cpe:/o:linux:linux_kernel:2.6

ReportItem.description: Using a combination of remote probes (e.g., TCP/IP, SMB, HTTP, NTP, SNMP, etc.), it is possible to guess the name of the remote operating system in use. It is also possible sometimes to guess the version of the operating system.
ReportItem.synopsis: It is possible to guess the remote operating system.
ReportItem.plugin_output:
Remote operating system : Linux Kernel 2.2 Linux Kernel 2.4 Linux Kernel 2.6 Confidence level : 54 Method : SinFP
The remote host is running one of these operating systems : Linux Kernel 2.2 Linux Kernel 2.4 Linux Kernel 2.6

ReportItem.pluginName: SSL Certificate Signed Using Weak Hashing Algorithm (Known CA)
ReportItem.description:
The remote service uses a known CA certificate in the SSL certificate chain that has been signed using a cryptographically weak hashing algorithm (e.g., MD2, MD4, MD5, or SHA1). These signature algorithms are known to be vulnerable to collision attacks. An attacker can exploit this to generate another certificate with the same digital signature, allowing the attacker to masquerade as the affected service.
Note that this plugin reports all SSL certificate chains signed with SHA-1 that expire after January 1, 2017 as vulnerable. This is in accordance with Google's gradual sunsetting of the SHA-1 cryptographic hash algorithm.
ReportItem.plugin_name: SSL Certificate Signed Using Weak Hashing Algorithm (Known CA)
ReportItem.solution: Contact the Certificate Authority to have the certificate reissued.
ReportItem.synopsis: A known CA SSL certificate in the certificate chain has been signed using a weak hashing algorithm.
ReportItem.plugin_output:
The following known CA certificates were part of the certificate chain sent by the remote host, but contain hashes that are considered to be weak.
|-Subject : O=Digital Signature Trust Co./CN=DST Root CA X3 |-Signature Algorithm : SHA-1 With RSA Encryption |-Valid From : Sep 30 21:12:19 2000 GMT |-Valid To : Sep 30 14:01:15 2021 GMT

ReportItem.pluginName: SSL Root Certification Authority Certificate Information
ReportItem.description: The remote service uses an SSL certificate chain that contains a self-signed root Certification Authority certificate at the top of the chain.
ReportItem.plugin_name: SSL Root Certification Authority Certificate Information
ReportItem.solution: Ensure that use of this root Certification Authority certificate complies with your organization's acceptable use and security policies.
ReportItem.synopsis: A root Certification Authority certificate was found at the top of the certificate chain.
ReportItem.plugin_output:
The following root Certification Authority certificate was found :
|-Subject : O=Digital Signature Trust Co./CN=DST Root CA X3 |-Issuer : O=Digital Signature Trust Co./CN=DST Root CA X3 |-Valid From : Sep 30 21:12:19 2000 GMT |-Valid To : Sep 30 14:01:15 2021 GMT |-Signature Algorithm : SHA-1 With RSA Encryption

ReportItem.description: The SSL certificate associated with the remote service will expire soon.
ReportItem.solution: Purchase or generate a new SSL certificate in the near future to replace the existing one.
ReportItem.synopsis: The SSL certificate associated with the remote service will expire soon.
ReportItem.plugin_output:
The SSL certificate will expire within 60 days, at May 29 16:39:40 2018 GMT :
Subject : CN=www.sitealeatorio.com.br Issuer : C=US, O=Let's Encrypt, CN=Let's Encrypt Authority X3 Not valid before : Feb 28 16:39:40 2018 GMT Not valid after : May 29 16:39:40 2018 GMT

ReportItem.description: This plugin connects to every SSL-related port and attempts to extract and dump the X.509 certificate.
ReportItem.synopsis: This plugin displays the SSL certificate.

ReportItem.description:
This script detects which protocols are advertised by the remote service to be encapsulated by TLS connections.
Note that Nessus did not attempt to negotiate TLS sessions with the protocols shown. The remote service may be falsely advertising these protocols and / or failing to advertise other supported protocols.
ReportItem.synopsis: The remote service advertises one or more protocols as being supported over TLS.
ReportItem.plugin_output:
The target advertises that the following protocols are supported over SSL / TLS :
h2 http/1.1

ReportItem.description: This plugin detects which SSL and TLS versions are supported by the remote service for encrypting communications.
ReportItem.synopsis: The remote service encrypts communications.
ReportItem.plugin_output: This port supports TLSv1.1/TLSv1.2.

ReportItem.description: Makes a traceroute to the remote host.
ReportItem.synopsis: It was possible to obtain traceroute information.

ReportItem.pluginName: Host Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) Resolution
ReportItem.description: Nessus was able to resolve the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the remote host.
ReportItem.plugin_name: Host Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) Resolution
ReportItem.synopsis: It was possible to resolve the name of the remote host.
ReportItem.plugin_output: 52.84.177.75 resolves as server-52-84-177-75.gru50.r.cloudfront.net.

ReportItem.description: The remote host implements TCP timestamps, as defined by RFC1323. A side effect of this feature is that the uptime of the remote host can sometimes be computed.
ReportItem.synopsis: The remote service implements TCP timestamps.

ReportItem.description:
This plugin is a SYN 'half-open' port scanner. It shall be reasonably quick even against a firewalled target.
Note that SYN scans are less intrusive than TCP (full connect) scans against broken services, but they might cause problems for less robust firewalls and also leave unclosed connections on the remote target, if the network is loaded.
ReportItem.solution: Protect your target with an IP filter.
ReportItem.synopsis: It is possible to determine which TCP ports are open.
ReportItem.plugin_output: Port 80/tcp was found to be open

ReportItem.description:
This plugin is a SYN 'half-open' port scanner. It shall be reasonably quick even against a firewalled target.
Note that SYN scans are less intrusive than TCP (full connect) scans against broken services, but they might cause problems for less robust firewalls and also leave unclosed connections on the remote target, if the network is loaded.
ReportItem.solution: Protect your target with an IP filter.
ReportItem.synopsis: It is possible to determine which TCP ports are open.
ReportItem.plugin_output: Port 443/tcp was found to be open
